channel.title: unicode on Memo Tut
channel.description: Recent content in unicode on Memo Tut

item.title: [Python] Using Unicode 6.0 emoji with django/MySQL
item.description: # Purpose From djangoEmojiaddedinUnicode6.0. Operating environment Python 3.2.0 or higher (confirmed to work with 3.4.3) Django 1.4.0 or higher? (Operation confirmed with 1.7.0, 1.8.1) mysqlclient(operationconfirmedwith1.3.3,1.3.6) MySQL 5.5.14 or later (operation confirmed with 5.5.40, 5.6.16) Python Python 3.2.0 or higher is required to use Unicode 6.0 emoji. django I haven’t exhausted the list of compatible versions of django. It works because it works on 1.7.0 and 1.8.1. mysqlclient Use mysqlclient for Python 3.
